thread.title: Tracy Morgan doing stand-up tour next year
thread.title_full: Tracy Morgan doing stand-up tour next year

author:
Compiled by Tony Hicks

thicks@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: Tracy Morgan doing stand-up tour next year
text:
Tracy Morgan doing stand-up tour next year Compiled by Tony Hicks Posted: 10/20/2015 02:24:13 PM PDT Updated: 10/20/2015 02:34:56 PM PDT Tracy Morgan is hitting the road. 
Seemingly bolstered by last week's appearance on "Saturday Night Live," the former "30 Rock" star is going to do a stand-up tour next year, according to CNN. 
Morgan was out of commission for more than a year after being seriously injured in a car wreck that took the life of his friend James McNair 
Called "Tracy Morgan: Picking Up the Pieces," the tour kicks off Feb. 5 in Hammond, Indiana, and will include stops at Washington, D.C.'s Kennedy Center and the Mirage Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas. 
The limo in which Morgan, McNair and four others were riding was hit by a Walmart truck in June 2014 on the New Jersey Turnpike. Morgan was hospitalized with broken ribs, a broken nose, and a broken leg. In this Oct. 17, 2015, photo, comedians Jack McBrayer, from left to right, Tina Fey, Tracy Morgan, Jane Krakowski, and Alec Baldwin stand on stage during a monologue on the show, in New York. (Dana Edelson/NBC via AP) 
Walmart settled lawsuits earlier this year brought by Morgan, McNair's family, and others involved in the crash. 
During Morgan's monologue last week -- during which he was joined by his old colleagues from "30 Rock" -- Morgan said "People were wondering, 'Can he speak? Does he have 100 percent mental capacity?' But the truth is I never did. I might actually be a few points higher now." Tony Hicks writes celebrity commentary for the Bay Area News Group. Contact him at Facebook.com/BayAreaNewsGroup.TonyHicks or Twitter.com/tonyhicks67 Advertisement
